sentence1: The Abbot of Inisfalen awoke before dawn of day.
sentence2: Under the dewy green leaves went he forth to pray.

sentence1: Under the dewy green leaves went he forth to pray.
sentence2: The prayers of his holy office he faithfully began to say.

sentence1: The prayers of his holy office he faithfully began to say.
sentence2: And for his sins' forgiveness a solemn prayer he said.

sentence1: And for his sins' forgiveness a solemn prayer he said.
sentence2: And he pray'd with loving-kindness for his convent-brethren dear.

sentence1: And he pray'd with loving-kindness for his convent-brethren dear.
sentence2: He pray'd a great prayer for Ireland, he pray'd with all his might.

sentence1: He pray'd a great prayer for Ireland, he pray'd with all his might.
sentence2: He pray'd a prayer for all men, he pray'd it from his heart.

sentence1: He pray'd a prayer for all men, he pray'd it from his heart.
sentence2: The Abbot of Inisfalen arose upon his feet.

sentence1: The Abbot of Inisfalen arose upon his feet.
sentence2: He heard a small bird singing, and O but it sung sweet!

sentence1: He heard a small bird singing, and O but it sung sweet!
sentence2: A song so full of gladness he never before had heard.

sentence1: A song so full of gladness he never before had heard.
sentence2: He had never heard such music since the hour that he was born.

sentence1: He had never heard such music since the hour that he was born.
sentence2: To follow the song and hearken this Abbot could never tire.

sentence1: To follow the song and hearken this Abbot could never tire.
sentence2: Till at last he well bethought him, he might no longer stay.

sentence1: Till at last he well bethought him, he might no longer stay.
sentence2: So he blessed the little white singing-bird, and gladly went his way.

sentence1: So he blessed the little white singing-bird, and gladly went his way.
sentence2: But, when he came to his Abbey, he found a wondrous change.

sentence1: But, when he came to his Abbey, he found a wondrous change.
sentence2: He saw no friendly faces there, for every face was strange.

sentence1: He saw no friendly faces there, for every face was strange.
sentence2: The strange men spoke unto him.

sentence1: The strange men spoke unto him.
sentence2: And he heard from all and each The foreign tongue of the Sassenach, not wholesome Irish speech.

sentence1: And he heard from all and each The foreign tongue of the Sassenach, not wholesome Irish speech.
sentence2: In Irish tongue, he spoke: "You wearest the holy Augustine's dress, and who hath given it to you?"

sentence1: In Irish tongue, he spoke: "You wearest the holy Augustine's dress, and who hath given it to you?"
sentence2: "I wear the holy Augustine's dress, and Cormac is my name.

sentence1: "I wear the holy Augustine's dress, and Cormac is my name.
sentence2: I went forth to pray, at the dawn of day.

sentence1: I went forth to pray, at the dawn of day.
sentence2: And when my prayers were said, I hearken'd awhile to a little bird that sung above my head."

sentence1: And when my prayers were said, I hearken'd awhile to a little bird that sung above my head."
sentence2: The monks to him made answer, "Two hundred years have gone over, Since our Abbot Cormac went through the gate, and never was heard of more.

sentence1: The monks to him made answer, "Two hundred years have gone over, Since our Abbot Cormac went through the gate, and never was heard of more.
sentence2: he said, "and the world will pass away.

sentence1: he said, "and the world will pass away.
sentence2: "Now, give me absolution, for my time is come," said he.

sentence1: "Now, give me absolution, for my time is come," said he.
sentence2: And they gave him absolution as speedily as might be.

sentence1: And they gave him absolution as speedily as might be.
sentence2: Then, close outside the window, the sweetest song they heard.

sentence1: Then, close outside the window, the sweetest song they heard.
sentence2: The monks looked out and saw the bird.

sentence1: The monks looked out and saw the bird.
sentence2: They buried his blessed body where lake and greensward meet.
